channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Bitcoin OG bets surprising sum on BTC hitting $100K before the halving
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Adam Back has joined a growing roster of market commentators who are bullish on the price of Bitcoin ahead of next year’s halving event.

item.title: Controversy as MakerDAO's Spark Protocol blocks users with VPNs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Users attempting to access Spark Protocol with a virtual private network will not be able to, sparking criticism from supporters of privacy.

item.title: Curve Finance opens bounty after exploiter's return deadline expires
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Curve Finance is extending a $1.85 million bug bounty offer to anyone who can identify the exploiter of its stable pools.

item.title: SHIB, UNI, OKB and HBAR flash bullish signs as Bitcoin volatility hits record low
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin remains stuck in a tight range, but select altcoins such as SHIB, UNI, OKB and HBAR are attracting buyers.

item.title: Huobi's TVL drops to $2.5B amid rumors of insolvency, investigations in China
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The exchange faces ongoing rumors about its stablecoins reserves and an alleged investigation by Chinese authorities.

item.title: OPNX exchange bids for crypto lender Hodlnaut in Singapore: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: If approved, the deal would see a capital injection of nearly $30 million worth of FLEX tokens into Hodlnaut to partially cover creditors' payout and outstanding claims.

item.title: XRP price disappoints after court ruling, Deaton remains optimistic
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: While the pro-XRP lawyer didn’t anticipate XRP reaching a new all-time high after the ruling, he did expect the price to surpass the $1 resistance level.

item.title: Bitcoin price can go ‘full bull’ next month if 200-week trendline stays
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin and crypto are in line for a classic breakout should multiple time-tested patterns continue, says analyst Cole Garner.

item.title: Tether unveils mining software to boost efficiency and capacity
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: The recently introduced Tether BTC mining software’s primary aim is to enhance the efficient management of mining capacity.

item.title: X will foot legal bills of users unfairly treated by employers for posting or liking content — Elon Musk
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The move appears to be in support of people that were fired or mistreated at work for liking or posting certain content.

item.title: FBI warns of phishing scams and social media account hijackers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The FBI warned that the account hijackers work to “create a sense of urgency” with their posts and urged people to vet any website or potential opportunity before clicking on it.

item.title: Alchemix reports return of all stolen funds from Curve pools
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The attacker started returning stolen funds after accepting a bug bounty of almost $7 million.

item.title: DeFi faces stress test, DoJ fears run on Binance, Hong Kong’s crypto trading: Hodler’s Digest, July 30 – Aug. 5
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Editorial Staff
item.description: Curve Finance’s dramatic exploit exposes DeFi, DoJ concerns of a run on Binance, and Hong Kong debuts retail crypto trading.

item.title: New York AG probes transactions at Genesis, ties with Barry Silbert: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Digital Currency Group is reportedly under investigation in New York for financial transactions involving its subsidiary, Genesis Global Capital.

item.title: What is Hooked Protocol, and how does it work?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Dilip Kumar Patairya
item.description: Hooked Protocol is a gamified on-ramp layer hosting learn-and-earn projects that also facilitates onboarding onto Web3. Find out about the Hooked ecosystem and how it works.

item.title: Boosting adoption with DeFi asset management: Velvet Capital joins Cointelegraph Accelerator
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Serkan Keskin
item.description: The decentralized asset management OS Velvet Capital that is driving DeFi adoption joins the Cointelegraph Accelerator program.

item.title: CDC report underscores importance of judge’s verdict in Ripple case
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: The CDC expressed satisfaction with the ruling, which aligned with their amicus brief supporting Ripple.

item.title: No crypto plans for X: Elon Musk debunks scam token claims
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: Elon Musk addressed the issue of scam tokens falsely claiming connections to the social media platform.

item.title: BTC hodlers outperformed crypto funds by 69% in H1: 21e6 Capital
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: According to 21e6 Capital AG, crypto funds generally outperformed the price gains of BTC in previous bull runs, but they ultimately suffered this year from having too much cash on hand and playing it safe.

item.title: JPEG’d confirms return of 5,495 ETH from Curve hacker
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The hacker drained several pools on Curve Finance, stealing roughly $70 million, but has gradually started returning funds to various projects.

item.title: The absurd AI mania is coming to an end
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Chris Coll-Beswick
item.description: AI large language models raised over $25 billion in the first half of 2023. The industry is starting to look like a bubble that’s about to burst.

item.title: CBDC supporter likely in White House next term, crypto divide not red vs. blue: Grayscale
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The crypto asset manager looked at the leading U.S. presidential candidates’ positions and did not see a partisan divide.

item.title: Coinbase CEO says leaving US ‘not even in the realm of possibility right now’ — Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Brian Armstrong has previously suggested Coinbase might abandon the U.S. for a more crypto-friendly country, but also said the exchange was “100% committed” to the local market.

item.title: Crypto Biz: Worldcoin plans to open source data, MicroStrategy preps for BTC halving, and more
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: This week’s Crypto Biz looks at Worldcoin’s expansion plans, GameStop’s exit from crypto, MicroStrategy’s quarterly results and Nomura’s crypto license in Dubai.

item.title: Curve-Vyper exploit: The whole story so far
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Curve Finance pools were targeted by hackers in a reentrancy attack on July 30, sending shockwaves across the DeFi ecosystem. Cointelegraph compiled the week's events.

item.title: Coinbase earnings show the company is now much more than just an exchange
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: The Coinbase earnings report shows that services and subscriptions are the exchange’s core revenue streams. Is this a positive or a negative?

item.title: CRV exposure risk throws a curveball at the DeFi ecosystem: Finance Redefined
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Most DeFi tokens traded in the red on weekly charts due to the chaos caused by the Curve Finance exploit.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Serge Egon Ostman
item.category: why did the Fed pause rates
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting the Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: Crypto asset investment in Latvia declines by 50% over past year, per central bank
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: According to Latvijas Banka, 4% of the population bought crypto assets in February, down from 8% in 2022, while payments “continue to prevail.”

item.title: Price analysis 8/4: BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, DOGE, ADA, SOL, MATIC, LTC, DOT
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin continues to range trade, and altcoin traders are starting to view BTC’s price consolidation as a positive sign for the rest of the crypto market.
